item.title: What is Rasa?
item.description: Rasa is a term from Indian aesthetics that refers to the emotional flavor or essence of a work of art, literature, or performance.

item.title: What is Puja?
item.description: Puja is a religious ritual performed by Hindus, Jains, and Buddhists as an act of worship towards a deity or a group of deities.

item.title: What is Yin Yoga?
item.description: Yin Yoga is a slow-paced, meditative style of yoga that involves holding passive stretches for extended periods of time.

item.title: What is Prasad?
item.description: Prasad refers to the food offerings made to a deity as part of Hindu worship.

item.title: What is a Mandala?
item.description: A mandala is a geometric design that represents the universe in Hindu and Buddhist symbolism.

item.title: What is Lineage?
item.description: Lineage in yoga refers to the transmission of knowledge and teachings from teacher to student.

item.title: What is Hamsa Yoga?
item.description: Hamsa Yoga is a term used in Hindu and Tantra yoga philosophy to refer to the union of the individual soul (jivatman) with the supreme soul (paramatman).

item.title: What is Evil?
item.description: In the context of yoga, the concept of “evil” refers to the negative attributes or actions that prevent an individual from reaching a state of spiritual liberation or enlightenment.

item.title: What is Ether?
item.description: In Ayurvedic medicine, ether (also known as “akasha” or “akash”) is one of the five fundamental elements that make up the universe, along with air, fire, water, and earth.

item.title: What is Egoism?
item.description: Egoism, in yoga philosophy, refers to the identification of the self with the ego, or the false sense of self.

item.title: What is Om Namah Shivaya?
item.description: Om Namah Shivaya is a sacred Hindu mantra, or chant, that is believed to be a powerful invocation of the Hindu god Shiva.

item.title: What is Om?
item.description: Om, also spelled Aum, is a sacred sound and a spiritual symbol in Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism.

item.title: What is Consciousness?
item.description: “Consciousness” refers to the state of being aware of one’s thoughts, feelings, and surroundings.

item.title: What is a Mantra
item.description: A mantra is a word or phrase that is repeated during meditation to help focus the mind.

item.title: What is Baba Nam Kevalam?
item.description: Baba Nam Kevalam (Sanskrit: बाबा नाम केवलम) is a mantra that is often used in the practice of yoga and meditation.

item.title: What is Matangi Mudra?
item.description: Matangi mudra is a hand gesture used in the practice of yoga and meditation.

item.title: What is Meditation and how does it work?
item.description: Meditation is a practice in which an individual focuses their mind on a particular object, thought, or activity to achieve a mentally clear and emotionally calm state.

item.title: What is Mindfulness?
item.description: Mindfulness is the practice of paying attention to the present moment with an open and non-judgmental attitude.
